articles.author: David Swanson, Kanishka Singh
articles.description: Over ten thousand people were ordered to evacuate communities northwest of Los Angeles as fierce seasonal winds drove a wildfire down tinder-dry hillsides into ranches and homes, authorities said.
articles.title: Thousands under evacuation near Los Angeles as wildfire torches homes

articles.author: Nandita Bose, Joseph Ax, Steve Holland
articles.description: U.S. President Joe Biden was set to address the nation on Thursday after a stinging election defeat for his Democratic Party at the hands of Republican Donald Trump, whose stunning political comeback has reverberated around the world.
articles.title: Biden set to address nation after Trump's decisive U.S. election win

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israeli forces stepped up bombardment across the Gaza Strip and ordered more evacuations, creating a fresh wave of displacement.
articles.title: More families stream out of north Gaza, as tanks push deeper

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: German Economy Minister Robert Habeck said on Thursday that Chancellor Olaf Scholz was right to fire the finance minister, spelling an end to the coalition government, and insisted that Germany was still capable of functioning.
articles.title: Germany still capable of functioning, economy minister says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: President Vladimir Putin condemned the United States on Thursday for seeking to inflict a strategic defeat on Russia in Ukraine and said a struggle was underway to shape a new world order as the Western-dominated post-Cold War era crumbled.
articles.title: Putin, after Trump win, says a struggle for a new world order is underway

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Mozambican police fired tear gas at hundreds of opposition supporters converging on the capital Maputo on Thursday for the biggest demonstration yet against last month's disputed election.
articles.title: Mozambique police fire tear gas as opposition supporters march on capital

articles.author: Matt Spetalnick, Humeyra Pamuk
articles.description: The Biden administration will make a final push for elusive deals to end the wars in Gaza and Lebanon, but Donald Trump's election may leave Washington without enough leverage to bend Israel and other regional players to its will before he becomes president.
articles.title: Biden plans final Mideast peace push but will leaders ignore him?

articles.author: Gabriela Selser
articles.description: Members of U.S. President-elect Donald Trump's transition team reached out to a leading Nicaraguan opposition figure on Thursday, saying they want to unite exiled communities from Nicaragua, Cuba, and Venezuela, the opposition figure said.
articles.title: Trump's team keen to unite anti-dictatorship exiles, Nicaragua dissident says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The United States has had conversations with Israel in the past week about establishing the first meeting of a channel for Washington to raise and discuss civilian harm incidents in Gaza, the State Department said on Thursday.
articles.title: US had talks with Israel on setting up Gaza civilian harm channel

articles.author: Jason Lange
articles.description: Americans see immigration as the most pressing issue for President-elect Donald Trump to address, and a large majority believe he will order mass deportations of people living in the U.S. illegally, a Reuters/Ipsos poll that closed Thursday found.
articles.title: Americans see immigration as top issue for Trump to tackle, Reuters/Ipsos poll finds
